Wednesday, April 11, 2007























Globe-trotting gamer blasts competition
It's a battle that parents have fought with their kids since the dawn of "Pong" -- too much time playing video games and not enough time studying. But Jonathan Wendel, better known as Fatal1ty, has turned gaming into a lucrative career. He's won $500,000 in prize money, has multiple sponsorships and his own 'Fatal1ty' brand where he sells computer hardware and clothing.
FULL STORY

Googling your date
Dating used to be largely a matter of spending time with a love interest, discovering the good, the bad and the ugly in person. If you were lucky, friends helped fill in some of the blanks. But the Internet has forever changed the rules.
FULL STORY






New 3-D movies more than a gimmick
A growing number of blockbuster, live-action films and animated movies are expected to be offered in 3-D in the next few years, as thousands of theaters around the country buy equipment needed to show the films.
FULL STORY






Google Earth maps out Darfur atrocities
In an effort to bring more attention to the ongoing crisis in Darfur, the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum has teamed up with the Google Earth mapping service to map out the carnage in the Darfur region.
FULL STORY






Free speech protects MySpace
A judge violated a juvenile's free-speech rights when he placed her on probation for posting an expletive-laden entry on MySpace criticizing a school principal, the Indiana Court of Appeals ruled.
FULL STORY
